name: Bronson J. Brown
statement:
**Legal/Judicial Experience**  
General Counsel, Kennewick School District, Grandview School District ; City Attorney, City of West Richland, City of Union Gap: City Prosecutor, Richland, Pasco and West Richland, Legal Counsel, Fluor Hanford, (2007-2008); Attorney, Bell, Brown, & Rio; Hearing Officer, Pasco School District; Hearing Examiner, Benton City (2005-2008)  
  
**Other Professional Experience**  
Adjunct professor, Columbia Basin College, (2006- 2011)  
  
**Education**  
Kennewick High School, 1994; Central Washington University, BA Law & Justice, Spanish (2000); California Western School of Law, J.D. (2002)  
  
**Community Service**  
Board President, Benton Franklin Legal Aid; Board Member, Boys & Girls Club; Scoutmaster, Boy Scouts of America  
  
**Statement**  
Tri-City native Bronson Brown and Wendy, his wife of 23 years, reside in Kennewick with their 5 children. Bronson has represented clients in most levels of our judicial system. He has successfully argued all types of criminal and civil cases in district, superior and federal district courts, and the state court of appeals. He has represented cities and school districts, county agencies, and Hanford contractors. Bronson is passionate about improving access to justice including helping persons without the means for legal representation. He has represented individuals in a variety of civil matters, from domestic disputes to adoptions. Collectively this experience has given him perspective on the variety of cases experienced by a Superior Court judge.  
  
Bronson believes a judge should serve with impeccable honesty and integrity. Judges have a duty to protect our liberties and fundamental rights afforded under the federal and state constitutions. Bronson is committed to serve by applying/interpreting the law without bias and irrespective of any personal or political views.  
  
Bronson tries to live a balanced and healthy life. He enjoys running and cycling, escaping to the outdoors with his family, and serving in his church and community.
